page.title: 06Ashorne College
page.content: Ashorne college is the management training centre for the British Steel Corporation. In addition to in house courses, it provides courses on steel management for other mainly commonwealth countries and also acts as the training centre for the Health and Safety Executive. The teaching facilities consist of 5 lecture rooms and 12 seminar rooms. On average the College has 75 students in attendance and deals with 2 400 students in a year. The College employs 70 people; 12 teaching staff 15 administrators, 15 in the kitchen, 30 cleaners and 5 gardeners. 12 of the staff live on the site. The College stands on 120 acres of ground, but only utilises 35 acres itself, the rest being let to a small holder and as grazing land.
